display_title.display_title:
Zaire - Higher Education
            Rationalization Project : Credit 1839 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

18153141.count: Congo, Democratic Republic of,CONGO, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Higher
            Education Rationalization Project is the formulation and
            adoption of a long-term higher education strategy geared to
            the training needs of the economy.  In addition, and while
            awaiting adoption of this strategy, the project supports
            independently justified, high priority measures.  These
            measures are justified by the urgent need to halt a very
            serious decline in management so that existing scarce
            resources are used more efficiently, and in educational
            quality so that minimum acceptable teaching/learning
            standards are at least maintained.  To meet these
            objectives, the project comprises:  (a) improving
            administration/management; (b) upgrading teaching/learning;
            (c) strategy development; and (d) priority teaching
            materials.  The project would benefit the whole higher
            education sub-sector, including the three Universities of
            Kinshasa, Lubumbashi and Kisangani together with the 32
            Technical and Pedagogical Institutes and the Higher
            Education Ministry through strengthened statistics and
            analysis for improved management, financial procedures and
            strategy development, in addition to training of key
            administrators and teachers.
